title: Synthetic Recap
body:
INDIANAPOLIS — On a night when offense was a precious commodity, one man had a monopoly. Tim Hardaway didn't just carry the Miami Heat; he authored a legendary performance, pouring in a career-high 38 points to will his team to a nail-biting 97-95 victory over the Indiana Pacers.

From the opening tip, Hardaway was a maestro. While the Pacers' Reggie Miller fought through a tough shooting night to finish with 21 points, Hardaway was operating on a different plane. He was a whirlwind of crossovers and clutch shooting, slicing through the Indiana defense with a determination that seemed to suck the air out of Market Square Arena.

The game hung in the balance until the final seconds, a back-and-forth war of attrition. But with the outcome on the line, it was inevitably Hardaway’s ball and Hardaway’s moment. He was the engine, the scorer, and the closer, his 38 points standing as an unanswerable argument against any defense the Pacers could muster.

This was more than a win; it was a statement performance from a superstar at his peak. On a night where every point was critical, Tim Hardaway didn't just score—he dominated, etching his name into the franchise's record books and stealing a critical road victory with a performance for the ages.
